modules.description: type 'd t = { read: unit -> 'd; write: 'd -> unit; close: unit -> unit } Provides operations to read from, write to, and close a data stream, supporting sequential access. Works with typed data streams where each read or write operation processes a single value of a specific type. Used to handle input from files, network sockets, or user input, and output to similar destinations with type-safe data handling.

Provides functions for managing handshake protocols, including signal synchronization, data transfer coordination, and timing validation. Operates on signal bundles, state machines, and clock-domain crossing structures. Used to implement reliable communication between asynchronous components in hardware design.

Manages data streams with read, write, and close operations, enabling sequential processing of typed values. Supports input and output operations on various data sources and destinations, ensuring type safety during data exchange. Reads and writes individual values of any type, such as integers, strings, or custom records. Can handle file I/O, network communication, or interactive input by processing data one element at a time.
